Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the complaint, Southwest has been denying some of its workers in Oakland the right to use earned paid sick leave.
Document Sources.Source Justification: the complaint filed in Alameda County Superior Court

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In December 2020, the city and Southwest signed a settlement in which, among other things, the airline agreed to fully restore the sick leave hours it had canceled for certain workers between 2017 and 2020.
Document Sources.Name of Source: City of Oakland and Southwest Airlines

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Oakland has several laws that protect workers, including Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters that established a minimum wage and requires employers to provide paid sick leave to employees.
Document Sources.Source Justification: Measure FF, a 2014 ordinance approved by Oakland voters

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Last year, this relatively new department ordered a Radisson Hotel in East Oakland to pay $404,491 to workers who were allegedly underpaid for nearly a year.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Document Sources.Source Justification: the order from Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The City of Oakland is committed to protecting workers by ensuring that all employers in Oakland are complying with laws that protect their rights,” Parker said in a statement.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: City Attorney Barbara Parker filed a lawsuit in Alameda County Superior Court

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. We hope that Southwest policies and practices will finally change for good,” Eric Swygert, a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555, said in a statement.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a Southwest employee and an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside that the assertion that any Oakland employee was forced to work while sick or take unpaid absences is unfounded.

“Southwest Airlines fully complies with applicable sick leave laws in Oakland and California, as well as with the terms of a December 2020 settlement agreement with the city,” the spokesperson said in a statement.
In a press release, the city attorney said Southwest’s practices were especially detrimental during the COVID-19 pandemic, when workers were forced to report to work even when they were sick.
Some of the newer complaints from Southwest workers were filed with Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards, which enforces wage and hour laws in the city.
Named Organization Sources.Name of Source: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: enforces wage and hour laws in the city
